text:
From: Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy.
To: The church of the Thessalonians in union with God the Father and the Lord Jesus, the Messiah.
May grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus, the Messiah, be yours!
speaker: Narrator

text: We always thank God for all of you when we mention you in our prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the presence of our God and Father, we constantly remember how your faith is active, your love is hard at work, and your hope in our Lord Jesus the Messiah is enduring.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers whom God loves, we know that he has chosen you,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the gospel we brought did not come to you in words only, but also with power, with the Holy Spirit, and with deep conviction. Indeed, you know what kind of people we proved to be while we were with you, acting on your behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text: You became imitators of us and of the Lord. In spite of a great deal of suffering, you welcomed the word with the joy that the Holy Spirit produces.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, you became a model for all the believers in Macedonia and Achaia.
speaker: Narrator

text: From you the word of the Lord has spread out not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place where your faith in God has become known. As a result, we do not need to say anything about it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For people keep telling us what kind of welcome you gave us and how you turned away from idols to serve a living and true God
speaker: Narrator

text: and to wait for his Son whom he raised from the dead to come back from heaven. This Jesus is the one who rescues us from the coming wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you yourselves know, brothers, that our visit to you was not a waste of time.
speaker: Narrator

text: As you know, we suffered persecution and were mistreated in Philippi. Yet we were encouraged by our God to tell you his gospel in spite of strong opposition.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our appeal to you does not spring from deceit, impure motives, or trickery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rather, because we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel, we speak as we do, not trying to please people but God, who tests our motives.
speaker: Narrator

text: As you know, we did not come with flattering words or with a scheme to make money. God is our witness!
speaker: Narrator

text: We did not seek praise from people—from you or from anyone else—
speaker: Narrator

text: even though as apostles of the Messiah we might have made such demands. Instead, we were gentle among you, like a nursing mother tenderly caring for her own children.
speaker: Narrator

text: We cared so deeply for you that we were determined to share with you not only the gospel of God but our very lives. That is how dear you were to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers, you remember our labor and toil. We worked night and day so that we would not become a burden to any of you while we proclaimed the gospel of God to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You and God are witnesses of how pure, honest, and blameless our conduct was among you who believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know very well that we treated each of you the way a father treats his children.
speaker: Narrator

text: We comforted and encouraged you, urging you to live in a manner worthy of God, who calls you into his kingdom and glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here is another reason why we constantly give thanks to God: When you received God’s word, which you heard from us, you did not accept it as the word of humans but for what it really is—the word of God, which is at work in you who believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you, brothers, became imitators of the churches of God in Judea that are in union with the Messiah Jesus. You suffered the same persecutions from the people of your own country as they did from those Jews
speaker: Narrator

text: who killed the Lord Jesus and the prophets, who have persecuted us, and who please neither God nor any group of people,
speaker: Narrator

text: as they try to keep us from telling the gentiles how they can be saved. As a result, they are constantly adding to the number of sins they have committed. However, wrath has overtaken them at last!
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers, although we have been separated from you for a little while—in person but not in heart—we eagerly desire to see you again face to face.
speaker: Narrator

text: That is why we wanted to come to you. Certainly I, Paul, wanted to come time and again, but Satan blocked our way.
speaker: Narrator

text: After all, who is our hope, joy, or reason for rejoicing in the presence of our Lord Jesus at his coming? It is you, isn’t it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, you are our glory and joy!
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, when we could stand it no longer, we decided to remain alone in Athens
speaker: Narrator

text: and send Timothy, our brother who works with us for God in the gospel of the Messiah, to strengthen and encourage you in your faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that no one would be shaken by these persecutions, for which you are aware that we were destined.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact, when we were with you, we told you ahead of time that we were going to suffer persecution. And as you know, that is what happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when I could stand it no longer, I sent Timothy to find out about your faith. I was afraid that the tempter had tempted you in some way, and that our work had been a waste of time.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Timothy has just now returned from visiting you and has told us the good news about your faith and love. He also told us that you always have fond memories of us and want to see us, just as we want to see you.
speaker: Narrator

text: That’s why, brothers, in all our distress and persecution we have been encouraged about you by your faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: For now we can go on living, as long as you continue to stand firm in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can we thank God enough for you in return for all the joy that we have in God’s presence because of you?
speaker: Narrator

text: We pray very hard night and day that we may see you again face to face, so that we may equip you with whatever is lacking in your faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now may our God and Father and our Lord Jesus provide a way for us to visit you.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord greatly increase your love for each other and for all people, just as we love you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then your hearts will be strong, blameless, and holy in the presence of God, who is our Father, when our Lord Jesus appears with all his saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then, brothers, you learned from us how you ought to live and to please God, as in fact you are doing. We ask and encourage you in the Lord to do so even more.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know what instructions we gave you through the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is God’s will that you be sanctified: You must abstain from sexual immorality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each of you must know how to control his own body in a holy and honorable manner,
speaker: Narrator

text: not with passion and lust like the gentiles who do not know God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, you must never take advantage of or exploit a brother in this regard, because the Lord avenges all these things, just as we already told you and warned you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God did not call us to be impure, but to be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, whoever rejects this instruction is not rejecting human authority but God, who gives you his Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now you do not need anyone to write to you about brotherly love, since you have been taught by God to love each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact, you are showing love to all the brothers throughout Macedonia, but we urge you, brothers, to keep on doing this even more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, make it your goal to live quietly, to mind your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we instructed you,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may win the respect of outsiders, and have need of nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we do not want you to be ignorant, brothers, about those who have died, so that you may not grieve like other people who have no hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so through Jesus God will bring those who have died with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we declare to you what the Lord has told us to say: We who are alive and remain until the coming of the Lord will by no means precede those who have died.
speaker: Narrator

text: With a shout of command, with the archangel’s call, and with the sound of God’s trumpet, the Lord himself will come down from heaven, and the dead who belong to the Messiah will rise first.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we who are alive and remain will be caught up in the clouds together with them to meet the Lord in the air. And so we will be with the Lord forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, encourage one another with these words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now you do not need to have anything written to you about times and dates, brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: for you yourselves know very well that the Day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: When people say, “There is peace and security,” destruction will strike them as suddenly as labor pains come to a pregnant woman, and they will not be able to escape.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, brothers, you are not in the darkness, in order that the Day of the Lord might surprise you like a thief.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all of you are children of the light and children of the day. We do not belong to the night or to darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, let’s not fall asleep like others do, but let’s stay awake and be sober.
speaker: Narrator

text: For people who go to sleep, go to sleep at night; and people who get drunk, get drunk at night.
speaker: Narrator

text: But since we belong to the day, let’s be sober. We must put on the breastplate of faith and love, and the hope of salvation as a helmet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God has not destined us to receive wrath but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus, the Messiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who died for us in order that, whether we are awake or asleep, we may live together with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, encourage one another and build each other up, as you are doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers, we ask you to show your appreciation for those who work among you, set an example for you in the Lord, and instruct you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hold them in the highest regard, loving them because of their work. Live in peace with each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: We urge you, brothers, to admonish those who are idle, cheer up those who are discouraged, and help those who are weak. Be patient with everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make sure that no one pays back evil for evil. Instead, always pursue what is good for each other and for everyone else.
speaker: Narrator

text: Always be joyful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Continually be prayerful.
speaker: Narrator

text: In everything be thankful, because this is God’s will for you in the Messiah Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not put out the Spirit’s fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not despise prophecies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, test everything. Hold on to what is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep away from every kind of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the God of peace himself make you holy in every way. And may your whole being—spirit, soul, and body—remain blameless when our Lord Jesus, the Messiah, appears.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who calls you is faithful, and he will continue to be faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers, pray for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss.
speaker: Narrator

text: I order you by the Lord to have this letter read to all the brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the grace of our Lord Jesus, the Messiah, be with you! Amen.
speaker: Narrator
